intro: Cynoglossum cheranganiense, commonly known as the Kenyan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring full sun. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
